description: Younger customers may be more likely to churn as they have less attachment to the brand.
Customers with higher monthly payments may be more likely to churn as they may be more price-sensitive.
Customers who have had multiple interactions with customer service may be more likely to churn due to unresolved issues.
Customers with shorter contract lengths may be more likely to churn as they have less commitment to the service.
Customers who use the service less frequently may be more likely to churn as they may not find it valuable.
Customers who are presented with better offers from competitors may be more likely to churn.
Customers with lower satisfaction scores may be more likely to churn as they are not happy with the service.
Customers who experience frequent service outages or poor quality may be more likely to churn.

Customers located in areas with poor service coverage or infrastructure may be more likely to churn.
Customers who do not receive personalized recommendations or offers may be more likely to churn as they feel undervalued.
